mydict = {
		"A": 1,
		"B": 2,
		"C": 0,
		"D": 1,
		"E": 0,
		"F": 0,
		"G": 0,
		"H": 0,
		"I": 0,
		"J": 0,
		"K": 0,
		"L": 0,
		"M": 0,
		"N": 0,
		"O": 1,
		"P": 1,
		"Q": 1,
		"R": 1,
		"S": 0,
		"T": 0,
		"U": 0,
		"V": 0,
		"W": 0,
		"X": 0,
		"Y": 0,
		"Z": 0
		}

loopcount = int(raw_input())
input = []
for i in range(loopcount):
	input.append(raw_input())

for j in range(len(input)):
	count = 0
	for k in input[j]:
		count += mydict[k]
	print count
